bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
After upgrading to 0.57 I got the following warning: <denchmark-code>WARNING:param: Setting non-Parameter class attribute opts.Segments = <classmethod object at 0x1188ce610> </denchmark-code>
With version 0.55 which was installed before the upgrade no warning was issued. <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
In a fresh environment and simple app I did not have the warning. It only appeared in an existing environment/project. <denchmark-h:h2>Is this a regression?</denchmark-h>
yes <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit version: 0.57.2 Python version: 3.7.6 Using Conda OS version: macOS 10.15.4 Browser version: Chrome 80.0.3987.149

comments.comment: I'm closing this --- after restarting the environment I was not witnessing this warning anymore.
